intro: Puccinellia fasciculata subsp. pseudodistans, commonly known as the slender spikegrass, is a perennial grass species native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. The plant has slender,丛生 (clumping) growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often arranged in dense clusters. It plays an important role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
